data.text: @CJRosenbaum Funny that I read his name initially as "barfman" not "brafman." The mind is a funny thing.
Brafman also said he intends to file a Motion to Dismiss --  calling the charges legally flawed and not supported by credible evidence.

Weinstein's attorney Ben Brafman maintains that his client is not guilty of the charges -- "Mr. Weinstein has always maintained that he has never engaged in 
non-consensual sexual behavior with anyone. Nothing about today's 
proceedings changes Mr. Weinstein's position."
